title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Promoting
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Promoting 
fairness and transparency for business users of online intermediation services) 
Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 12 July 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (promoting fairness transparency business user online intermediation services) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 12 july 2020 interpretation

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Act of 2007” means the Consumer Protection Act 2007 (No. 19 of 
2007); 

“Commission” means the Competition and Consumer Protection 
Commission; 

“Council Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2019/1150 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 20 June 20192 on promoting 
fairness and transparency for business users of online intermediation 
services. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and which is 
also used in the Council Regulation has, unless the context otherwise requires, 
the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation. 

1 OJ No. L 186, 11.7.2019, p.57. 
2 OJ No. L 186, 11.7.2019, p.57. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
 “Iris Oifigiúil”24th of July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [256] 3 

Designated public body

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 3. The Commission is designated for the purposes of Articles 14(5)(b) of
text_raw:
3. The Commission is designated for the purposes of Articles 14(5)(b) of 

the Council Regulation. 

Offences
text_norm: 3 commission designated purpose article 14(5)(b) council regulation offence

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 4. (1) A provider of an online intermediation services who contravenes
text_raw:
4. (1) A provider of an online intermediation services who contravenes 
Articles 3(1), 3(2), 3(5), 4(1), 4(2), 4(3), 5(1), 5(3) 6, 7(1), 8, 9(1), 9(2), 
10(1),11(1), 11(2), 11(3), 11(4), 12(1), 12(3), 12(4), or 12(6) of the Council 
Regulation commits an offence. 

(2) A provider of an online search engine who contravenes Articles 5(2), 

5(3), 5(4) or 7(2) of the Council Regulation commits an offence. 

(3) A provider of an online intermediation service who commits an offence 
under paragraph (1) shall be liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or 
to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months, or to both. 

(4) A provider of an online search engine who commits an offence under 
paragraph (2) shall be liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or to 
imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months, or to both. 

(5) Sections 77, 78, 80 and 84 of the Act of 2007 shall apply to an offence 
under these Regulations as they apply to an offence under that Act and, 
accordingly, references in those sections to an offence under that Act shall be 
construed as including references to an offence under these Regulations. 

Register

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 5. The Commission shall establish and maintain a register of unlawful acts
text_raw:
5. The Commission shall establish and maintain a register of unlawful acts 
in accordance with Article 14(2) of the Council Regulation that have been the 
subject of an order before the Circuit Court or the High Court under section 71 
of the Act of 2007. 

Amendment of Act of 2007
text_norm: 5 commission shall establish maintain register unlawful act accordance article 14(2) council regulation subject order circuit court high court section 71 act 2007 amendment act 2007

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 6. The Act of 2007 is amended -
text_raw:
6. The Act of 2007 is amended - 

(a) 

in section 67, by the insertion of the following paragraph after 
paragraph (m) (inserted by Regulation 3 of the European Union 
(Payment Services) (Amendment) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 
255 of 2019): 

“(n) any contravention of the European Union (Promoting 
fairness and transparency for business users of online 
intermediation services) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. xxx 
of 2020),”, and 

(b) 

in Schedule 5, by the insertion - 

(i) 

in Column (1), of the following: “S.I. No. 256 of 2020”, 
and 

 
 
 
 
 4 [256] 

(ii) 

in Column (2), of the following: “the European Union 
(Promoting fairness and transparency for business users of 
online intermediation services) Regulations 2020”. 

Construction of References

title: users of online intermediation services, hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 7. (1) Section 75 of the Act of 2007 shall apply for the purposes of these
text_raw:
7. (1) Section 75 of the Act of 2007 shall apply for the purposes of these 
Regulations subject to the modification that references to a prohibited act or 
practice shall be construed as a reference to a contravention of these 
Regulations. 

(2) Section 87 of the Act of 2007 shall apply for the purposes of these 
Regulations subject to the modification that references to the relevant statutory 
provisions shall be construed as a reference to these Regulations. 

(3) Sections 10(1), 24, 35 and 36 of the Competition and Consumer 
Protection Act 2014 (No. 29 of 2014) shall apply for the purposes of these 
Regulations subject to the modification that references to the relevant statutory 
provisions shall be construed as a reference to these Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 July, 2020. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Minister of Business, Enterprise and Innovation. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [256] 5
